channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trust is the missing ingredient in the AI boom
item.description: There is a soft underbelly of the AI boom, a deep sense of unease about its employment effects and a lack of understanding of benefits to the consumer...

item.title: Elon Musk revives billionaire beef with Bill Gates, says he better exit his ‘crazy short’ against Tesla soon or else add to his $1.5 billion in losses
item.description: “I cannot take your philanthropy on climate change seriously when you have a massive short position against Tesla,” Musk said at the time Gates made h...

item.title: Pittsburgh’s airport just got a nature-focused makeover
item.description: Pittsburgh International Airport (PIT) was never really meant to serve Pittsburgh. When the modern airport opened in 1992, it was built as a hub for U...

item.title: ‘Trust is at an all-time low for both job seekers and recruiters’: Hiring platform CEO says talent acquisition is in an ‘AI doom loop’
item.description: The 2025 Greenhouse AI in Hiring Report found that only 8% of job seekers believe AI algorithms that screen initial applications make hiring fairer.

item.title: One man is responsible for the McDonald’s Dollar Menu, Pizza Hut’s stuffed crust, and Smashburger. Meet Tom Ryan
item.description: Ryan was a hitmaker everywhere he went, from Pizza Hut to Quiznos to McDonald's and beyond.

item.title: I banned my AI from sounding like AI
item.description: AI has a writing style, or, at least, an alleged style. Tools like ChatGPT and Claude seem to communicate with a tendency toward formalism. The chatbo...

item.title: Revisiting management systems
item.description: Today marks a milestone: my 250th “Playing to Win/Practitioner Insights” series post. Back on October 5, 2020, when I published the first piece in thi...

item.title: The Department of War rebrand could cost $2 billion
item.description: On November 14, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth, screwdriver in hand, helped Pentagon facilities personnel install two new signs that read “Department ...

item.title: Stock Market Investors Are Winning in the K-Shaped Economy
item.description: Consumer sentiment is falling while asset prices keep rising.

item.title: My Networking Meetings Don’t Lead Anywhere
Why renewable energy isn’t replacing fossil fuels faster
item.description: You might not know it from the headlines, but there is some good news about the global fight against climate change . A decade ago, the cheapest way t...

item.title: Beware the Coming Carnage in the Electric Vehicle Industry
item.description: Car buyers are no longer beating down dealers’ doors to get in line for the latest electric offerings, regardless of how smart the cars may be.

item.title: Why ‘Humble’ Leaders Tend to Be the Most Effective Leaders, Backed by Considerable Science
item.description: Don’t think you have all the answers? If you want to be a great leader, that’s a good thing.

item.title: 2 Words Explain How the MacBook Air Quietly Became ‘The World’s Most Popular Business Laptop’
item.description: An interview with Apple’s Mac and Enterprise Marketing teams about the rise of the MacBook Air in unexpected places.

item.title: Drone tracking startup SkySafe will pay you crypto to buy and install its sensor
item.description: SkySafe is carving out a role as the FlightAware for drones and wants people to contribute to its network by buying a $949 sensor.
